reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner decided to book this as a get away from the kids for one night away and what a find!!! We got lost on the way there and when we final drove up what a site I couldn't believe how quaint it looked. We received a warm and friendly welcome by the general manager (Jamie??) which was nice to see a manager so hands on. Hospitality was second to non all the staff we came across were so polite and helpful in offering local information and directions.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable I didn't want to leave. After walking in the country and going to the nearby town we went for dinner which was wonderful. All the staff were very accommodating and my partners was in his element with such an extensive wine list at which point I’d lost him to the manager who was very knowledgeable. I had scallops which were cooked perfectly and I had the pork belly as my main which was recommended. It was cooked to perfection and not fatty like allot of restaurants.
reviews.title: What a crying shame

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My partner and I will defiantly return to such a gem in the country side.
reviews.title: Wonderful break, wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Talk about trading on your previous owner's hard won reputation - Vicky Elliot and Mark Stephenson built the Museum up from scratch into one of the foremost pub/hotels in the UK - two steps in looking for lunch and I suspected trouble - all the atmosphere had evaporated. The pub appeared to be full of elderly day-trippers from Poole chasing an elusive Jamie Oliver review. Half-past-one - "Lunch for two please" - "Have you booked?" - "No (eyening two empty tables)" - "I'll just check - sorry, no" And that was that - no apology or explanation, no "if you can wait X minutes we'll be able to fit you in", no recommendation for somewhere else to go (in the middle of nowhere).
reviews.title: Perfect retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily at this point a lovely old gent at the bar said "Go to the King John in Tollard Royal, I've just come from there and I wish I'd stayed where I was." Throughout a very angry looking woman (manager?) who could quite easily have been dressed for a wedding appeared - stared at us, stared at the brave nice gent, stared at her three bar staff and said absolutely nothing, not "can I help you?" or "can I explain why a pub in Dorset can't feed you at 1.30 on a Friday?'
reviews.title: Gorgeous rural pub with lovely rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: So very disappointed the place has no atmosphere. Food was average no wow factor & trying to be top end, why don't these wonderful old places go back to good traditional honest food and leave it to the big boys! The staff were pleasant, barman looked as though everything was hard work, would not return as we have found this to be another souless gastro pub without the pub!
reviews.title: Disappointed no atmosphere average!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am posting a review because I am so disappointed with our stay at The Museum Inn.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition we wrote to the Museum inn after our stay and haven't even had an acknowledgement of our issues or a response. We have even sent a follow up e-mail and still no response. Not good enough!
reviews.title: Not very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay 8th October 2011
reviews.title: Not quite there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We booked this night away back in April as it came highly recommended. Two days pior to our stay I received a phone call informing me that the restaurant would not be available and that we could eat in either the bar area or the cottage.
reviews.title: Great food, nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh dear, I had stayed here before and always found it an excellent place. Sadly now the property is on the market it seems the owner has lost all interest in maintaining standards, we were "welcomed" eventually by an obtuse long hared gentleman ( who it later became evident was the owner) he seemed to have great difficulty pouring a simple drinks order, was unable to answer any questions regarding the menu and frankly didn't seem pleased to see us at all. He stood drinking at the bar all night, begrudgingy serving our (excellent) food and clearing our table only after an absurdly long wait. It was an expensive meal, though very well cooked, and all around I saw tables being professionally served by competent young ladies. It is still, just, an excellent location and as long as the waitresses can continue to function without any guidance and with a disinterested proprieter it will carry on being so. My advice, avoid being served by the owner and for the time beingyou may still enjoy this previously excellent establshment
reviews.title: a very unpleasant experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We would really struggle to find any fault in the Museum Inn. We only stayed for one night (unfortunately not longer) and it was absolutely perfect. Every member of staff is charming and they cannot do enough for you. The setting is gorgeous, the rooms very comfortable and the food is fantastic. Would not hesitate to recommend it.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really spoiling . Perfect country location, staff went well above call of duty to make us all feel very welcome .
reviews.title: A delightful country inn with a superb restaurant, a real find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little gem hidden away, total peace and quiet. A wonderful atmosphere in the bar, and the restaurant is delightful, lots of character and amazing stylish food.and superb wine list. A great location for exploring Dorset. Exceptional staff and the owner David is very hands on and great company, would highly recommend it. Nothing is too much trouble, he went out of his way to get us some delicious cheese from Bournemouth which is on their menu!! Very comfortable rooms/bathrooms, lovely beds, towels, linen etc. We will most definately be returning!
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS EXCELLENCE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Set in the middle of the beautiful Dorset countryside is this charming inn. The accommodation was extremely comfortable, the staff friendly and the food exceptional with wonderful presentation . Expensive but well worth it!
reviews.title: A high quality restaurant with rooms......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Off the beaten track, but well worth the trouble to find.
reviews.title: Lovely Place, Super Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb food. In a beautiful pub setting... Roast lunch on Sunday is a special treat!
reviews.title: Warm snug friendly retreat from hustle and bustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a lovely weekend at The Museum Inn, set in the middle of nowhere very pretty chocolate box village with walks on doorstep.
reviews.title: Food fine, rooms a rip off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When we arrived the Manager got the fire going for us in the bar served us drinks & told us a bit about the local area.
reviews.title: wonderful country retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room in the stable, these are the rooms available when you take you four legged friends with you. The room was smallish but was very clean, decor looked very fresh. Homemade biscuits nice touch. We also ate at The Museum and was not disappointed it was not cheap - but you get what you pay for. The bar and restaurant staff gave great service in a friendly relaxed but efficient manner.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant
